text.0: as twere some goodly treasure mātariśvan brought as a gift the glorious priest to bhṛgu.
text.1: banner of sacrifice the good protector child of two births the swiftly moving envoy.
text.2: both gods and men obey this rulers order gods who are worshipped men who yearn and worship.
text.3: as priest he takes his seat ere break of morning houselord adorable with men ordainer.
text.4: may our fair praise heartborn most recent reach him whose tongue een at his birth is sweet as honey.
text.5: whom mortal priests men with their strong endeavour supplied with dainty viands have created.
text.6: good to mankind the yearning purifier hath among men been placed as priest choiceworthy.
text.7: may agni be our friend lord of the household protector of the riches in the dwelling.
text.8: as such we gotamas with hymns extol thee o agni as the guardian lord of riches.
text.9: decking thee like a horse the swift prizewinner may he enriched with prayer come soon and early.
